titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the American Association of University Women, 1929-2011
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections SC 5036
titlepage.publisher: Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: This collection consists of the important papers and other documents of the Harrisonburg Branch of the American Association of University Women (AAUW) spanning from 1929 to 2011. It also contains some papers from other Virginia branches of the AAUW, including Winchester, Staunton, Richmond.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of Item], The American Association of University Women, 1929-2011, SC# 5036, Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, VA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Lorrie Merrow first donated 2 record storage boxes and 1 poster on November 17, 2011. Tina Updike later donated 10 linear feet of materials consisting of documents and scrapbooks on December 6, 2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The American Association of University Women was founded in 1882. The website states that the "AAUW advances equity for women and girls through advocacy, education, philanthropy, and research." This collection primarily covers the Harrisonburg branches actions and inner workings of the organization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The American Association of University Women (AAUW) Collection ranges in date from 1929 to 2011. Materials consist of papers as well as video, apparel, DVDs, CDs, scrapbooks, photos, and floppy disks. The collection focuses on the Harrisonburg Branch of the AAUW but there is information pertaining to the AAUW in VA and Nationwide. It is arranged in 12 series.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in 12 series:

blockquote.p: I: AAUW – The folders in this box contain materials that were transferred from their original folders or packaging to a new folder. No further sorting has been done, and any labeling has been transferred to the folder.
II: Bylaws- Ranging in date from 1967 to 1999.
III: Education- This contains many booklets that document women's struggle in the workforce as well as the AAUW's more internal education activities.
IV: Finance- This series contains information on every aspect of the AAUW's finances.
V: History- This contains newspaper articles and other historical moments of the AAUW as donated.

VI: Legal Documents and Activism- This series catalogs the range of actions that the AAUW took in support of various movements and issues. It also gives more information about the VA branch of the AAUW.
VII: Meeting Minutes- Range from 1929 to 2003.

VIII: Membership- This series catalogs every phase of membership from prospective to deceased. It also contains the forms, outreach materials, and policy sheets that would need to be filled out during that process. Mainly Harrisonburg Branch of the AAUW but there is some VA branch information.

IX: Publications-This series covers the publications, Graduate Woman, Outlook, The Link, Leader in Action, the AAUW Newsletter, The AAUW Program Guide, AAUW News, AAUW Journal, On Campus with Women, Action Alert, The Harrisonburg Branch Yearbook, The Inside Track, Virginia Vision, other VA Branch Newsletters, The AAUW Catalog, and other misc. publications.
X: Scrapbooks and Photo Albums- from 1929 to 1998.
XI: Special events and Conferences- from the 43rd Annual Convention to Convention of April 2006.
XII: Meeting Minutes- Range from 1929 to 2003.
